messageValues.message: =Turn the origin and destination into the ir airport codes. Make sure the departure and return dates are in the future, not the past. Here is the current date/time: {{ $now }}

parameters.text:
=This person is traveling to "{{ $('Webhook').item.json.body.destination }}" 
from "{{ $('Webhook').item.json.body.currentlocation }}" 
during these dates: "{{ $('Webhook').item.json.body.departuredate }}" 
until "{{ $('Webhook').item.json.body.returndate }}".

They are going for a "{{ $('Webhook').item.json.body.reasonoftravel }}" trip.

Your task is to act as a professional AI travel consultant.

Provide:
1. Visa requirements based on the traveler's origin and destination.
   - Specifically mention if a 30-day visa-free or Schengen-area stay applies.
   - Highlight any exceptions, online visa procedures, or entry-permit conditions.
2. Currency and payment tips (exchange rate, card acceptance, cash advice).
3. Cultural and safety insights relevant to European or nearby countries.
4. Health, connectivity, and emergency contact essentials.
5. If the trip duration is within 30 days and the destination is in Europe, 
   mention whether the traveler likely doesn‚Äôt need to apply for a visa.
6. Keep your tone warm, informative, and structured ‚Äî respond as a local travel expert.

Return your response as a clear, multi-section travel guide.

options.systemMessage:
=Updated prompt (paste this) You are an expert travel itinerary email creator. Your goal: generate a short, professional HTML email summarizing a user‚Äôs trip plan from structured JSON data. Return your response as JSON: { "subject": "...", "emailBody": "..." } Rules & Style Keep it concise, bullet-pointed, and mobile-friendly. Sections to include (only if data exists): Overview, ‚úàÔ∏è Flights, üè® Hotels, üéüÔ∏è Activities, ü™™ Visa Info. Spacing: add clear vertical space between sections (use margins/padding; no giant images). Lists: present all items as bullet points (no tables). 1‚Äì2 lines per bullet. Links: and keep link text short (‚ÄúView details‚Äù, ‚ÄúTicket info‚Äù). Images: small rounded thumbnails only when helpful, width ‚âà 160px. Skip empty sections entirely. Tone: friendly, concise, informative. Inputs (examples / paths) Flights flights.items ‚Üí JSON string of 1‚Äì2 objects: main_legs[], layovers[], lowest_price, departure_airport, arrival_airport Parse and list each flight like: Airline ‚Ä¢ ORG ‚Üí DST (times) ‚Ä¢ via LAYOVER(S) ‚Ä¢ from PRICE Hotels hotels.items ‚Üí JSON string of 1‚Äì2 objects: name, rating, price_per_night, total_price, link, image Bullet per hotel: Name ‚Äî rating ‚òÖ ‚Ä¢ price/night ‚Ä¢ Total: X ‚Ä¢ [View details] Activities activities.top_results ‚Üí JSON string of up to 3: {title, url} activities.images ‚Üí JSON string of up to 3 image URLs (optional thumbnails, small) Visa / Advice pre_travel_requirements.visa_and_passport ‚Üí plain text. Convert to 3‚Äì6 short bullets (strip headings/markdown). Output structure (HTML guidance) Use a single centered container
. Section title style: margin:20px 0 8px;font-weight:700; Bulleted list style:
    ...
Thumbnail style: width:160px;border-radius:8px;margin:6px 0;display:block; Optional (only if you explicitly decide to show videos) If videos.youtube_top3 is present and you choose to include, show as bulleted text links only (no thumbnails) to minimize mail-client previews.
